rule.name: Rouge
rule.message: Did you mean rogue? The number of cases in which 'rouge' is actually used intentionally, rather than as a typo of 'rogue' is vanishingly small.

rule.name: Physic
rule.message: Did you mean psychic? I've never seen someone use physic instead of physical or physique, only psychic

rule.name: Bokken
rule.message: Did you mean bokuto? bokken is plural

rule.name: Bokkens
rule.message: Did you mean bokken? bokken is plural

rule.name: Integral
rule.message: Did you mean Integra or Integral? The misspelling of "Sir Integra" as "Sir Integral" is much more common in fanfiction than "Integral"

rule.name: Nekomimi
rule.message: Did you mean nekomusume? Nekomimi is specific to girls wearing FAKE cat ears and tail. I have yet to find a fanfic where the author didn't actually mean nekomusume.

rule.name: Saki
rule.message: Did you mean saké? Japanese rice wine is "saké", not "saki".

rule.name: Tonto
rule.message: Did you mean tanto? The short dagger-like Japanese sword used when committing seppuku is called a "tanto", not a "tonto".

rule.name: Sempei
rule.message: Did you mean sempai? The suffix used for the name of someone who is your senior in an organization is pronounced sempai, and the literal translation of the Japanese spelling is "senpai".

rule.name: Tomboki
rule.message: Did you mean Tomobiki? This is probably the worst misspelling I've ever seen.

rule.name: Gome
rule.message: Did you mean gomen? TODO: Confirm this correction.

rule.name: Shoji
rule.message: Did you mean shogi? "shoji" is a traditional Japanese sliding door. "shogi" is a Japanese chess-like game.

rule.name: Down Load
rule.message: Did you mean download? Download is one word.

rule.name: The Sight
rule.message: Did you mean the site or the sight? 50/50 chance

rule.name: A Shelve
rule.message: Did you mean a shelf or shelves?

rule.name: Buts
rule.message: Did you mean but or butt or butts?

rule.name: To Loose
rule.message: Did you mean too loose or to lose?

rule.name: Weary Of
rule.message: To be weary is to be tired. Did you mean wary of (on guard against threats from)?
rule.example: He was acting weary of them.
He was acting wary of them.

rule.name: All To Often
rule.message: Did you mean all too often?

rule.name: Welsh
rule.message: Did you mean welch? welsh is a valid nationality, but people usually mean "welch" (to break one's word or avoid payment) which "welsh" can also mean, but only the dictionary remembers that.

rule.name: Bats Wings
rule.message: Did you mean bat wings or bats' wings or bat's wings?

rule.name: Shrug It Of
rule.message: Did you mean shrug it off?

rule.name: Pointed To Wear
rule.message: Did you mean pointed to where?

rule.name: Said Her Peace
rule.message: Did you mean said her piece?

rule.name: Said His Peace
rule.message: Did you mean said his piece?

rule.name: A The
rule.message: Did you mean the or a?

rule.name: The A
rule.message: Did you mean a or the or the "A"?

rule.name: The More The Marrier
rule.message: Did you mean the more, the merrier?

rule.name: The Mail Post
rule.message: Did you mean the post or the mail or the mailbox or the postbox?

rule.name: Repaired To
rule.message: Did you mean retired to? "repaired to" is a valid fragment, but very uncommon as the correct thing to use

rule.name: That Thought It
rule.message: Did you mean <pronoun> thought it or "that thought, it"?

rule.name: Ones Rocks
rule.message: Did you mean one's rock or one rocks?

rule.name: Thank, <Name>
rule.message: Did you mean Thanks, <name> or Thank <name>?

rule.name: Your Sent
rule.message: Did you mean your scent or you sent?

rule.name: To Collage
rule.message: Did you mean to college? A "college" is an institute of higher learning. A "collage" is is a picture made of smaller pictures.

rule.name: Did Get That Either
rule.message: Did you mean didn't get that either?

rule.name: Bastered
rule.message: Did you mean bastard? The only way this correction could be wrong is if your story is weird enough to make baster (eg. "Turkey Baster". The giant syringe you use when cooking a turkey) into an impromptu verb.

rule.name: Way To Young
rule.message: Did you mean way too young?

rule.name: Apposing
rule.message: Did you mean opposing? apposing is a valid word, but I've never seen it in use. However, I've seen several cases where someone used it when they intended to use "opposing".

rule.name: Ying-Yang
rule.message: Did you mean yin-yang? The proper spelling, as transliterated from the Chinese pronounciation, is yin-yang. Also, though nobody will understand what you mean, the proper term for the symbol (yin-yang is the concept) is "The Taijitu".

rule.name: Your Late
rule.message: Did you mean you're late or your latté?

rule.name: Apart Of
rule.message: Did you mean a part of or apart from?

rule.name: Effected
rule.message: Did you mean affected? It seems far more common to find affected used incorrectly than correctly. I'll have to gather some statistics to test this hypothesis.

rule.name: Holding A Bowel
rule.message: Did you mean holding a bowl?

rule.name: The Crucio Curse
rule.message: Did you mean the cruciatus curse?

rule.name: Chocked
rule.message: Did you mean choked? I think "chocked" is a valid word (TODO: Confirm) but I've only ever seen it as a check-proof typo when the author intended to use "choked"

rule.name: Cannon Fodders
rule.message: Did you mean cannon fodder? "cannon fodder" is already plural.

rule.name: Sore Looser
rule.message: Did you mean sore loser? "looser" means "less tight". You are thinking of "loser".

rule.name: Asberger
rule.message: Did you mean Asperger? The syndrome is named after the guy who defined it, oddly as the spelling may seem to you.

rule.name: Pealing Potatoes
rule.message: Did you mean peeling potatoes? "pealing" is what a bell does. "peeling" is what you do to potatoes.

rule.name: Never Losses Its
rule.message: Did you mean never loses its? "losses" is the plural of "loss". The <TODO: term> of "lose" is "loses"

rule.name: Reek On
rule.message: Did you mean the? wreak on the You "reek" when you don't bathe. You "wreak" havoc or destruction.

rule.name: Way To Primitive
rule.message: Did you mean way too primitive?

rule.name: Coarse Of Act
rule.message: Did you mean course of action?

rule.name: The Entire Ally
rule.message: Did you mean the entire alley?

rule.name: Rapt Up In
rule.message: Did you mean wrapped up in?

rule.name: Strong As Steal
rule.message: Did you mean strong as steel?

rule.name: I Shutter To Think
rule.message: Did you mean I shudder to think?

rule.name: Fainted To The Side
rule.message: Did you mean feinted to the side? To "faint" is to lose consciousness. To "feint" is to fake an action to deceive your opponent.

rule.name: On A Side Not
rule.message: Did you mean On a side note?

rule.name: Moral Was Deteriorating
rule.message: Did you mean morale was deteriorating or morals were deteriorating?

rule.name: The Boarders Of The <Proper Noun> Empire
rule.message: Did you mean the borders of the <proper noun> empire? "boarders" either ride skateboards or snowboards, or they are renting a room from someone. The edges of a country or empire are "borders".

example.marker: the boarders of the <proper noun> empire
the borders of the <proper noun> empire

rule.name: Are Quiet Common
rule.message: Did you mean are quite common?

rule.name: God Son
rule.message: Did you mean godson or god's son?

rule.name: \D Of
rule.message: Did you mean two of? It's rarely good form to use numbers that way.

rule.name: A Rouse
rule.message: Did you mean a ruse or a rise?

rule.name: The Vile Of
rule.message: Did you mean the vial of?

rule.name: A Vile Of
rule.message: Did you mean a vial of?

rule.name: Male Tomcat
rule.message: Did you mean tomcat? A tomcat is, by definition, male.

rule.name: Mental Scaring
rule.message: Did you mean mental scarring? Scaring is to Scare and Scarring is to Scar.

rule.name: Night Cloths
rule.message: Did you mean nightclothes? TODO: Confirm the lack of a space.

rule.name: Waist Of Time
rule.message: Did you mean waste of time?

rule.name: Heavy As Led
rule.message: Did you mean heavy as lead?

rule.name: Their Is Always
rule.message: Did you mean there is always?

rule.name: Allot
rule.message: Did you mean a lot or all of?

rule.name: Your Still In
rule.message: Did you mean you're still in? The only case I can think of where this correction would be in error is if "still" is a noun. (the kind of equipment you use to manufacture alcohol at home)

rule.name: The Jest Of It
rule.message: Did you mean the gist of it?

rule.name: Give ? Some Advise
rule.message: Did you mean give ? some advice?

rule.name: What To Ware
rule.message: Did you mean what to wear?

rule.name: Needles To Say
rule.message: Did you mean needless to say?

rule.name: Out Of Site
rule.message: Did you mean out of sight? A "site" is a location. "Sight" is a type of perception.

rule.name: Defiantly Change
rule.message: Did you mean definitely change or defiantly change? It's much more common for "defiantly change" to be a typo than the intended phrase.

rule.name: Supressed A Shutter
rule.message: Did you mean supressed a shudder?

rule.name: A Descent Person
rule.message: Did you mean a decent person?

rule.name: Raged
rule.message: Did you mean ragged or raged? raged is a valid word (paste tense of "to rage"), but it's also a typo of ragged.

rule.name: Sacummed
rule.message: Did you mean succumbed? This correction even eludes aspell, so it has to be in the typomap.

rule.name: In Good Conscious
rule.message: Did you mean in good conscience?

rule.name: Some Descent Skills
rule.message: Did you mean some decent skills? While the current form is valid english, the odds of it being the intended spelling are miniscule.

rule.name: Getting To Old
rule.message: Did you mean getting too old?

rule.name: More Stronger
rule.message: Did you mean stronger or more powerful?

rule.name: If I Here
rule.message: Did you mean if I hear?

rule.name: Took You As Granted
rule.message: Did you mean took you for granted?

rule.name: Crack Pot
rule.message: Did you mean crackpot or crack, pot?

rule.name: Be Dominate
rule.message: Did you mean be dominant or be dominated or dominate?

rule.name: Sore Above The Clouds
rule.message: Did you mean soar above the clouds?

rule.name: Defiantly Has
rule.message: Did you mean definitely has or has defiantly?

rule.name: Cloths
rule.message: Did you mean clothes or pieces of cloth? "Cloths" is the plural short form of "washcloth". It's almost always used in error in fiction.

rule.name: Don'T Why
rule.message: Did you mean don't know why or don't care why?

rule.name: And All There
rule.message: Did you mean and all their?

rule.name: Miss Blaise
rule.message: Did you mean X!X!X? Blaise is a masculine name from France. Would you name a girl "David" or "Jacob"?

rule.name: Ms. Blaise
rule.message: Did you mean X!X!X? Blaise is a masculine name from France. Would you name a girl "David" or "Jacob"?

rule.name: Butter Beer
rule.message: Did you mean butterbeer? It's just one word.

rule.name: Virginia
rule.message: Did you mean Ginevra? Ginny is short for Ginevra, not Virginia.

rule.name: Chine
rule.message: Did you mean China or Shine?

rule.name: Bokken
rule.message: Did you mean bokuto? bokken is plural and 99% of the time it's used, the writer should have used the singular form.

rule.name: Kirara
rule.message: Did you mean Kimiko? Unless your story is a crossover with InuYasha, please consider this correction for what is probably the name of Soun Tendo's late wife.

rule.name: Rep
rule.message: Did you mean reputation or representative? Not even Ranma would shorten "reputation" to "rep" and everyone else would use whichever full word was correct. So say many fanfiction connoisseurs.

rule.name: Baka
rule.message: Did you mean jerk or idiot or stupid? It was only cool the first time we read it. With the exception of things that don't translate very well like -san, -kun, -chan, and -bozu, and nouns like attack and object names, fics looks more professional with only translated content.

rule.name: School Of Everything Goes
rule.message: Did you mean School of Anything Goes? Now this is just plain laziness unless you are writing one of those "Ranma loses the right to practise Anything Goes and comes up with his own school" stories.

rule.name: Beantos
rule.message: Did you mean Bentos or Bentous? Pick your favorite correction. Both are correct, depending on which romanization you personally prefer.

rule.name: U-Chan
rule.message: Did you mean Ucchan? I know. It's an odd spelling, but a far as I can tell, it's the correct one.

rule.name: Musks
rule.message: Did you mean Musk? When used as the name of a tribe, you don't put 's' on the end.

rule.name: Red Head
rule.message: Did you mean redhead or red head? "Red head" is valid, but it's usually a typo for "redhead".

rule.name: Tai Kuan Do
rule.message: Did you mean Tae Kwon Do? It's not Japanese; It's Korean. Use the proper Korean transliteration.

rule.name: Jhusenkyou
rule.message: Did you mean Jusenkyo or Jusenkyou? I've never seen Jusenkyo transliterated with an h in official Ranma materials.

rule.name: Romiko
rule.message: Did you mean Rumiko? Ranma 1/2 was created by Rumiko Takahashi.

rule.name: Kunjio
rule.message: Did you mean Kuonji? Ukyo's family name is transliterated as Kuonji.

rule.name: You,? Anata
rule.message: Did you mean you,? dear? Anata translates to an affectionate "you", not "dear".

rule.name: Dowse
rule.message: Did you mean douse? To get someone wet is to "douse" them. To psychically search for something with a pointed stick is to "dowse" for it.

rule.name: Mau Uniform
rule.message: Did you mean Mao uniform? Geeze. Mau is a breed of cat. Mao was a Chinese dictator.

rule.name: Jocketzu
rule.message: Did you mean Joketsu? TODO: Confirm that this correction is valid. Should it be Joketsuzoku instead?

rule.name: Xaim-Pu
rule.message: Did you mean Xian-pu or Shan-pu or Shampoo?

rule.name: Mzu-Tzu
rule.message: Did you mean Mu-tzu or Mu-tse or Mousse?

rule.name: At The Alter
rule.message: Did you mean at the altar?

rule.name: Bare \W? An Heir
rule.message: Did you mean bear ? an heir?

rule.name: Konatsu Kenzan
rule.message: Did you mean Konatsu? Kenzan is a title, not a name.

rule.name: Koucho Kuno
rule.message: Did you mean Principal Kuno? Koucho means Principal. It's a title and, for the sake of consistency and readability, should be translated as such.

rule.name: Neremians
rule.message: Did you mean Nerimians? I doubt there's a proper english word for "People of Nerima", but Nerimians is at least using the proper root word.

rule.name: Bonborries
rule.message: Did you mean bonbori? Bonbori is plural.

rule.name: Bayenkala
rule.message: Did you mean Bayankala? TODO: Confirm spelling.

rule.name: Amy
rule.message: Did you mean Ami? Don't use the names from the english dub. They make the more experienced fans shudder.

rule.name: Mina
rule.message: Did you mean Minako? Don't use the names from the english dub. They make the more experienced fans shudder.

rule.name: Serena
rule.message: Did you mean Usagi? Don't use the names from the english dub. They make the more experienced fans shudder.

rule.name: Bunny
rule.message: Did you mean Usagi? Don't use the names from the english dub. They make the more experienced fans shudder.

rule.name: Ray
rule.message: Did you mean Rei? Don't use the names from the english dub. They make the more experienced fans shudder.

rule.name: Lita
rule.message: Did you mean Makoto? Don't use the names from the english dub. They make the more experienced fans shudder.

rule.name: Susan
rule.message: Did you mean Setsuna? Don't use the names from the english dub. They make the more experienced fans shudder.

rule.name: Scouts
rule.message: Did you mean senshi? Senshi (the original Japanese name) means Soldiers, not Scouts. Don't devalue the characters.

rule.name: Yuma
rule.message: Did you mean youma? Unless it's the name of a new character specific to your fanfic, it can only be a typo. If it's a character name, it'll make experienced fans cringe.

rule.name: Selenity
rule.message: Did you mean Serenity? I was amazed to see that someone used "engrish" in a fanfic.

rule.name: Hotura
rule.message: Did you mean Hotarui? I don't know whether this correction would be obvious to a spell-checking algorithm.

rule.name: Makato
rule.message: Did you mean Makoto? TODO: This line should be part of the aspell supplemental dictionary I construct

rule.name: Zoasite
rule.message: Did you mean Zoisite? TODO: Confirm the spelling of the correction.
